summary: Slightly more vibrant days; a lil less dark nights..
descriptionHtml:
[color=4169E1][size=6][u][b]NOTE:[/b][/u][/size][/color]

[size=4] I have uploaded a new INI config meant to be used with \'Imaginator\'; please visit [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=14869]Zoners Realistic Lighting and Imaginator settings[/url][/size]

[size=4] Checkout my High performance ENB config at [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=15551]Zoners High Performance ENB[/url][/size]

[color=4169E1][size=3][u][b]Version 1.1[/b][/u][/size][/color]
A slightly different dawn; and small tweaks to the day settings. Older version is still available for download in case you like it better.

[color=4169E1][size=3][u][b]Effects Tried to achieve:[/b][/u][/size][/color]
1) Night: Dark but not unplayable nights; emphasis to torches and light sources 
2) Dawn: Bright and Visually appealing skies and terrain
3) Day: Quite close to the default RL settings actually
4) Dusk: A little brighter and reddish
5) Interiors and Dungeons: More of an emphasis on Light sources; dark, but you can make do without a torch as long as at least one light source is present nearby.

[color=4169E1][size=3][b][u]Installation:[/b][/u][/size][/color]
You require [u][url=http://www.skyrim.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=7654]\"Realistic Lighting with Customization\"[/url][/u] installed first.
Just drag and drop the INI and the ESP into the \"Data\" folder. 
Make sure to keep a backup of your own RL files in case you dont like these settings. 

[color=4169E1][size=3][b][u]Uninstallation:[/b][/u][/size][/color]
Delete Realisticlighting.ini and RealisticLightingPatcher.esp, or replace them with your backups.

[color=4169E1][size=3][b][u]NOTE: (Anyone facing Crashing Issues)[/b][/u][/size][/color]
1) Again make sure that you have \"Realistic Lighting With Customization\" installed and that its esp is active!
2) Make sure that realisticlightingpatcher.esp is AFTER Realisticlighting.esp in the load order!
3) Try pasting only the INI into your \"Data\" folder and generate the patcher.esp yourself by running \"realisticlightingpatcher.jar\" 

[color=4169E1][size=3][b][u]Known Issues[/b][/u][/size][/color]
1) The snow is too bright close to mid-day, i suggest waiting till 4pm or so ;)
2) Dungeons/Interiors have some areas that are pitch black, am working on some adjustments to fix that, since i hate having to use torches!
3) Some areas might be too bright around mid-day on \"Clear days\".

[color=4169E1][size=3][b][u]Credits:[/b][/u][/size][/color]
Plutoman101 for \"Realistic Lighting With Customization\" and his excellent guide on how to tweak it.
Bethesda Softworks for this amazing Game!
author: Shrutesh
